Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc: Instrument Overview =================== The Larson FTS is a portable infrared fourier transform spectrometer incorporating an Idealab Inc. model IF-3 interferometer and with a beam-splitter serving three detectors, a PbS detector covering the range 0.87 - 4.0 microns, an InSb detector covering 2.7 - 5.6 microns, and a cold-filtered InSb detector covering 0.87 - 2.7 microns. The superiority of the InSb detectors largely obviates the use of the PbS detector. This instrument provides 0.5 cm^-1 spectral resolution and is portable for use at various telescopes. The instrument is described in detail in Larson and Fink 1975 (Applied Optics 14, 2085) and in Larson and Fink 1977 (Applied Spectroscopy 31, 386).
